ygData.subject: Re: Our class
ygData.msgSnippet: Unfortunately, the answer to your question is no.  Once you are PvP, you can t cast ANY spells on nonPCP ppl, even if its benefical and they are in your party.
ygData.messageBody:
Unfortunately, the answer to your question is no. Once you are PvP, you
can't cast ANY spells on nonPCP ppl, even if its benefical and they are in
your party. I found this out the hard way when a friend of mine started a
new cleric, accidentally turned the book in (he was new and didn't know what
turning the book in meant), and then tried to cast heal on me. It said I
was protected from his spells, even though I was in the same group as him.
Major bummer.

There is a rumor of a quest out there that can turn you back to nonPvP. I
don't know what it is though and I'm not even sure if its implemented yet.
Hope this helps.

Talarin, High Elven Wizard

----- Original Message -----
From: Edward Clint <sate@...>
To: <eq_wizards@onelist.com>
Sent: Wednesday, April 21, 1999 1:30 PM
Subject: [eq_wizards] Re: Our class


> From: "Edward Clint" <sate@...>
>
> Queston:
>
> First of all as a PK Wizard I protest the inability of a PK wiz to cast
bind
> on a nPK person who is in your party(exactly whats the reasoning here
> anyway?)
>
> long those lines I wonder, when I am Level 29 or whatever and get
> group-teleport spells.. Can I actually teleport my group? Even if they are
> nPK and I am PK? After finding out about bind, its clear theres little
logic
> here other than making a PKs life harder for no obvious reason.
>
> -Sate
>
